page.title: 13CLEEVE COMMON
page.content: THE FORT IS ON A HIGH PLATEAUX.FROM IT THERE IS A MARVELLOUS VIEW OF THE LANDSCAPE FOR MILES AROUND.IT IS SURROUNDED BY BRIDLE PATHS AND OTHER TRACKS THAT GO ALL OVER THE COMMON. THE COTSWOLD WAY IS THE MOST FAMOUS PATH.NEAR THE FORT IS CLEEVE CLOUD ONE OF THE HIGHEST POINTS.HUDDLESTONES TABLE IS A LARGE SEMICIRCULAR STEEP LEDGE JUST BELOW AN IRON AGE EARTHWORK. PEOPLE PRACTISE ROCK CLIMBING FROM HERE. THERE ARE A FEW HOUSES AT THE BOTTOM OF THE HILL WHICH ARE SHELTERED BY QUEEN'S WOOD NUTTERSWOOD AND THRIFT WOOD. THESE WOODS CONTAIN CONIFEROUS AND NON CONIFEROUS TREES BELONGING TO MANOR FARM.
